thread.title: Win, lose or draw: Waldo County squads run gamut over wild weekend
thread.title_full: Win, lose or draw: Waldo County squads run gamut over wild weekend

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Win, lose or draw: Waldo County squads run gamut over wild weekend
text:
High school boys and girls soccer Win, lose or draw: Waldo County squads run gamut over wild weekend By Staff | Oct 12, 2015 
Win, lose or draw, Waldo County high school soccer teams saw a variety of outcomes on the soccer pitch on Saturday, Oct. 10 with Mount View and Searsport in action. 
While the Viking squads came up short against host Richmond, the Mustang boys blanked Maine Central Institute of Pittsfield and the Mustangs girls salvaged a tie with the Huskies. 
The following is a recap of reported results: 
Boys soccer 
Mount View 3, Maine Central Institute 0 
At Pittsfield Oct. 10, the Mustangs blanked the host Huskies. 
Mikey Hustus scored two goals and added one assist in the win, while Damien Doughty (goal) and Brandon Reynolds (assist) also chipped in on offense. 
Seth Davis made five saves on five shots in net for Mount View, while Aiden Peacock made 13 saves on 16 shots in goal for MCI. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Mount View (3-9, 15.5102 points) is 16th, while Ellsworth (10-0-1, 110.9439 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Richmond 3, Searsport 0 
At Richmond Oct. 10, the Bobcats blanked the visiting Vikings. 
Curtis Anderson, Brendan Emmons and Brady Johnson scored for Richmond, off assists by Logan Anair, Cody Tribbet and Nate Vintinner. 
Ben Powell made 11 saves in goal for the Vikings, while Zach Small made three saves in net for the Bobcats. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class D South, Searsport (7-3-1, 56.50501 points) is fifth, while Buckfield (12-1, 102.7187 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Girls soccer 
Mount View 1, Maine Central Institute 1 (2OT) 
At Thorndike Oct. 10, the Mustangs and Huskies settled for a stalemate. MCI led 1-0 at halftime. 
Kate Arthurs scored, off an assist by Kate Bennett, in the 68th minute for Mount View, while Sydney Morton scored in the 18th minute for MCI. 
Jenni Nadeau made two saves on four shots in net for Mount View, while Aubrey McCannell made 17 saves on 23 shots in goal for MCI. The Mustangs led 4-3 in corner kicks. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Mount View (5-5-2, 42.1684 points) is 10th, while Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston (11-0-1, 126.9898 points) is first in the 18-team region. The top 12 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Richmond 4, Searsport 0 
At Richmond Oct. 10, the Bobcats blanked the visiting Vikings. 
Autumn Acord (2 goals, assist), Meranda Martin (2 goals, assist) and Kelsea Anair (assist) led the Richmond offense. 
Brooklynn Alberts made 10 saves in goal for the Vikings, while Sydney Tilton made four saves in net for the Bobcats. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class D South, Searsport (7-4, 40.3061 points) is fourth, while Richmond (10-1, 97.2087 points) is first in the 10-team region. The top seven teams qualify for the playoffs.
